Position Summary:
NAR is looking for an experienced and highly skilled Director of Data Science to join NAR's IT team. The Director of Data Science will work as a hands-on leader and manage a very capable data science team on a broad range of topics and projects focused on providing actionable insights to key stakeholders and learning more about our members. Reporting to the Vice President of Information Technology, the Director of Data Science will be a strategic leader who can take the data science capability to the next level. This individual should have ample experience in driving data science related projects with in-house as well as consulting project teams.

The ideal candidates will be able to work effectively in a fast-paced setting, bring a fresh perspective to the data science domain, be passionate about data and all that can be derived from it, and be a collaborative team player.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Shape vision for data science/predictive analytics applications for all areas of the organization
Ability to drive data science programs and projects and see them to their successful completion
Experience with building analytical models to solve complex problems
Hands on experience with data visualization utilizing industry standard tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Have experience with applications on Azure or AWS and their AI/ML tools
Experience with the full machine learning life cycle including predictive data analytics, including data preprocessing model building, and evaluation
Research and implement enterprise best practices in predictive data analytics
Identify and implement appropriate technologies and techniques, from a non-analytical such as data store and analytical perspective such as models like Neural Networks
Identify, evaluate, build, and implement infrastructure and methodologies for enhanced data collection, storage, cataloging, descriptive analysis and predictive modeling and presentation
Design technological solutions that ensure data completeness and accuracy across data mining initiatives
Design technological solutions that ensure reporting consistency across analytical initiatives
Deliver data products and dashboards that help enhance understanding of organization trends, and support member's businesses
Connect and collaborate with data science leaders and experts within and outside of the industry and keep pulse on data science innovations and ensure that REALTORS® are at the forefront of data-driven innovation
Educate, mentor, and train the data science team, other IT teams, staff, and members on data science
Other duties, as assigned

Qualifications:

Minimum of 8-10 years of overall data science experience
Working knowledge and experience in Cloud, endpoint, server, database, application, and cyber security
Detail, problem solving, and great organizational skills.
Excellent communication skills with ability to provide appropriate level of detail (verbal and written) to both technical and non-technical individuals.
Results oriented with high attention to detail, ability to multi-task, and meet deadlines in a dynamic, fast-paced team environment
Highly collaborative and team oriented
Ability to travel up to 10%

Organizational Overview:
The National Association of REALTORS® (NAR) is a team of professionals dedicated to providing world-class service to over 1.5 million REALTORS® working in the United States and around the world. The real estate industry is fast-paced and fast-changing--each year, our members participate in the sale, lease, and management of billions of dollars in real estate. As in every industry, our members' value proposition is constantly being challenged by innovation.

It is our mission to help REALTORS® navigate that change and thrive in their careers. We cannot do that without the ideas, passion, and commitment from our talented employees. As our greatest assets, employees are offered their pick of competitive benefits/perks and flexible work options. NAR is certified as a Great Place to Work®. Our most successful employees are committed to our Core Values, which are:

Putting members first
Leading change
Advancing Diversity and Inclusion
Giving respect
Collaborating
Communicating

About GrowthBook
Here at GrowthBook we are building an open source A/B testing platform and transforming the way product decisions are made. The top 1% of companies spend thousands of hours making their own highly custom A/B testing platforms. We’ve created GrowthBook to give all companies the power and flexibility of a custom in-house experimentation system without having to build it themselves.
The world of product development is increasingly moving towards data-driven decision making, and the best way to objectively measure the impact of a product is with A/B testing. Top companies already know this, and test everything they ship. As these methods spread, A/B testing will increasingly be part of all product development processes, and will require a new set of tools which are highly integrated and customized to the product and data. GrowthBook is that platform.
Since we launched in May 2021, we’ve added over 1,500 stars on GitHub, and we are the most popular active open source experimentation platform. We’re used by hundreds of companies, and are working closely with fast-growing and large early adopters to help shape our product. Our business has increased 7x in August alone.
Our platform is built using modern tech by very experienced engineers, and backed by top investors. We believe in open source and product-led growth, and we’re focused on building something awesome that our users love.
GrowthBook is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to creating an inclusive, supportive environment for all employees.
We regret that we cannot sponsor employment visas at this time.

About the role
We are looking to hire a senior data scientist to join our growing team and lead our data science initiatives. This role is fully remote. We have a lot of hard data science problems to solve, from advanced Bayesian statistics to machine learning. You will get to work directly with our customer’s data teams and regularly meet with top experimentation experts from Uber, Netflix, Facebook, and more to ensure we’re on track to build the best data science and experimentation platform on the planet. As an early employee, you will wear many hats, have opportunities to touch and influence all aspects of the product, and build a team.
Requirements
5+ years of experience of data science experience
Proficient with SQL and Python
Advanced degree in statistics or similar field (or equivalent industry experience)
You know how to balance statistical rigor vs the need to move quickly. You have a good understanding of when something is “good enough”.
Bonus: Managed a team before, or worked at a small startup
Bonus: Familiarity with data engineering and data warehouses
Benefits
Generous compensation and employee-friendly equity in a fast-growing early-stage well-funded startup
Unlimited time off
Medical insurance including dental and vision (US)
Generous parental leave
Work-from-home stipend and IT budget
Remote-first company with regular off sites in exciting locations (once Covid allows us to safely travel again)

At Talkdesk, we are disruptive risk-takers, don't have a traditional way of doing things, and will do whatever it takes to build a product that improves customer experiences. We help people solve problems in moments that matter.

Join the adventure and grow with us. With $268 million in funding and more than 1,800 customers, we're revolutionizing the industry of contact centers. Join a hyper-growth company that's innovative, bold, and ambitious. Be a part of the future of technology and make an impact on an evolving industry. If you're a self-starter and hungry to learn, apply now and enjoy the ride.

We're looking for the rare breed of data scientist who loves to use their expertise to solve business problems. Your models won't languish in the lab. They will go to production, where they will impact the daily lives of millions of people.


What are we doing?

At Talkdesk we are reimagining how people experience contact centers, helping our customers create long lasting and meaningful relations with their customers. The capacity to make sense of the message that is being conveyed when we communicate has been reserved to humans alone, but we are building the next generation of solutions that will mimic our ability to understand language, ensuring that the customer needs are always well understood and efficiently handled. We are a growing team of curious and talented people that are focused on leveraging the power of Natural Language Processing, audio signal processing, and machine transcription, to deliver added value to our customers.


What do we need?

We are looking for a talented Data Scientist. We need someone that is a natural problem solver, who likes to be challenged, has the drive to explore and is committed to quality. We expect you to be a truly team player, reliable and easy to communicate with. You will have to leverage different techniques to deliver state of the art solutions around natural language understanding and generation. More specifically, you will have to:

Focus on delivering working products/models to production. We don't do pure science at Talkdesk. We do products. We're looking for data scientists who geek out on solving business problems and impacting millions of people's daily lives.
Explore, clean and transform large datasets of unstructured data;
Analyze complex problems and recommend adequate solutions according to the identified requirements;
Apply, combine and fine tune different Natural Language Processing techniques to achieve the best results;
Design, implement and maintain scalable and performant architectures to support the idealized solutions.


What are we looking for?

Experience developing, delivering and operating machine learning-based software in production in the cloud.
Familiarity with NLP tasks (e.g. Information Retrieval, Recommender Systems, Topic Modeling, Summarization, etc);
Familiarity with Machine Learning algorithms (Neural Networks, SVM, Markov Models, Decision Trees, etc);
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc).
Familiarity with MLFlow is a plus.


The Talkdesk story hinges on empathy and acceptance. It is the shared goal among all Talkdeskers to empower a new kind of customer hero through our innovative software solution, and we firmly believe that the best path to success for our mission is inclusivity, diversity, and genuine acceptance. To that end, we will hire, promote, work along, cheer for, bond with, and warmly welcome into the Talkdesk family all persons without regard to ethnic and racial identity, indigenous heritage, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

The Challenge:
Are you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set? Are you fascinated by the possibilities presented by the IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence advances? In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open up new opportunities. As a data scientist, you can turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors — from fraud detection, to cancer research, to national intelligence — you know the answers are in the data.
We have an opportunity for you to use your leadership and analytical skills to solve military intelligence challenges. You’ll work closely with your customer to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environment to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You'll support the development and application of data mining, analysis, aggregation, fusion, and visualization to process, analyze, and integrate data and information that facilitates research, analysis, production and dissemination of Scientific and Technical Intelligence (S&TI) and General Military Intelligence (GMI) assessments. You’ll provide your customer with a deep understanding of their data, what it all means, and how they can use it. Join us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our nation's leaders.

Stanley Black and Decker (SBD) is committed to deep and ongoing investment in Data & Analytics capability. SBD is seeking a Director of Data Science to build and lead our next-generation data science / data engineering capability, supporting wide range of enterprise-wide analytics-driven products to drive business value.

What You ll Do
As a Director of AI & Data Science, you ll be part of our Data & Analytics team located remotely.

Reporting directly to SBD s VP of Analytics and working with peers in advanced analytics, analytics software development and business / process execution, you will be responsible for:
Build / lead a world-class team of data scientists, BI developers and data engineers
Work with various internal business partners, external customers and IT to ensure stable and solid pipelines and platforms to / from analytics systems and applications
Build and maintain next-generation data science / data engineering platforms for our external products as a strategic competency for SBD.
Build and maintain a world-class cloud-based environment / Platform to support Data Science and Advanced Analytics solutions with the right access to the right data at all times
Support business impact: Deploying advanced analytics to improve and transform core processes, across all of Stanley Black and Decker s businesses and functions
Who You Are

You always strive to do a good job but wouldn t it be great if you could do your job and do a world of good? You care about quality at every level. You love to learn and grow and be acknowledged for your valuable contributions. You re not intimidated by innovation. In fact, you embrace it.

Significant relevant experience building data pipelines and environments to support advanced analytics solutions in industries including consumer durable goods, B2B equipment and B2B services.
Profound expertise in deep learning applications especially around big volumes of unstructured data (e.g. video, audio, sensor data)

Distributed computing: Deep expertise in the Hadoop framework and key components including HFDS, MapReduce, Spark, Cassandra, Hive, Pig
Production ETL and Pipeline expertise: Expert in design, build and maintenance of industrial-grade ETL and data pipelines for batch and streaming applications, to support broad range of analytics and business needs
Understanding of analytics methods/tools: Conversant/fluent in analytics topics including statistical modeling, supervised and unsupervised machine learning, Deep Learning and AI, design of experiments, text mining and natural language processing, network analysis, geo-spatial analytics optimization, simulation

Strong record of professional accomplishment and leadership

About GrowthBook
Here at GrowthBook we are building an open source A/B testing platform and transforming the way product decisions are made. The top 1% of companies spend thousands of hours making their own highly custom A/B testing platforms. We’ve created GrowthBook to give all companies the power and flexibility of a custom in-house experimentation system without having to build it themselves.
The world of product development is increasingly moving towards data-driven decision making, and the best way to objectively measure the impact of a product is with A/B testing. Top companies already know this, and test everything they ship. As these methods spread, A/B testing will increasingly be part of all product development processes, and will require a new set of tools which are highly integrated and customized to the product and data. GrowthBook is that platform.
Since we launched in May 2021, we’ve added over 1,500 stars on GitHub, and we are the most popular active open source experimentation platform. We’re used by hundreds of companies, and are working closely with fast-growing and large early adopters to help shape our product. Our business has increased 7x in August alone.
Our platform is built using modern tech by very experienced engineers, and backed by top investors. We believe in open source and product-led growth, and we’re focused on building something awesome that our users love.
GrowthBook is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to creating an inclusive, supportive environment for all employees.
We regret that we cannot sponsor employment visas at this time.

About the role
We are looking to hire a senior data scientist to join our growing team and lead our data science initiatives. This role is fully remote. We have a lot of hard data science problems to solve, from advanced Bayesian statistics to machine learning. You will get to work directly with our customer’s data teams and regularly meet with top experimentation experts from Uber, Netflix, Facebook, and more to ensure we’re on track to build the best data science and experimentation platform on the planet. As an early employee, you will wear many hats, have opportunities to touch and influence all aspects of the product, and build a team.

5+ years of experience of data science experience
Proficient with SQL and Python

You know how to balance statistical rigor vs the need to move quickly. You have a good understanding of when something is “good enough”.
Bonus: Managed a team before, or worked at a small startup
Bonus: Familiarity with data engineering and data warehouses
Benefits
Generous compensation and employee-friendly equity in a fast-growing early-stage well-funded startup
Unlimited time off
Medical insurance including dental and vision (US)
Generous parental leave
Work-from-home stipend and IT budget
Remote-first company with regular off sites in exciting locations (once Covid allows us to safely travel again)

Job Description
Data Science & Engineering is a crucial part of Shopify’s mission to make commerce better for everyone. We organize and interpret petabytes of data to provide solutions for our merchants and stakeholders across the organization. From pipelines and schema design to machine learning products and decision support, data science at Shopify is a diverse role with many opportunities to positively impact our success. The Data Science & Engineering team acts as the impact multiplier for Shopify’s product teams, putting over 11 petabytes of data to work to make our merchants more successful. From delivering merchandising insights to optimizing shipping and processing rates, to reducing credit card fraud, to ad campaign recommendations - our Data Scientists deliver solutions from pipeline to the platform via an array of open source tools.
We are looking for a Senior Data Science Manager to lead the team that partners with our Operate data team (part of Core). The Shopify Core is what’s “in the box” when merchants sign up for Shopify: the world’s best Online Store, Checkout, and the Admin to set up and run their business. The Operate’s Mission is to help merchants start and run their business on Shopify’s platform by building the most powerful Admin. Operate Data Science and Engineering team contributes to this mission by building best-in-class insights and data products to enable every merchant’s success.
What your role will look like:
Working closely with an interdisciplinary team, you and your team will be responsible for the evolution of all admin tools (such as admin home, navigation, search, etc.) across mobile and web and tackle the evolution of how our most sophisticated merchants are utilizing our platform (large organizations with multiple businesses and staff). Your team will focus on developing strong data foundations, data-informed products, and reporting and experimentation frameworks to empower the Operate organization to make great decisions quickly.
Qualifications
You will need to have:
Team development: You’ll need a demonstrated track record of attracting top data/analytics talent, developing those people (both ICs and managers) to make them even better, and managing the growth of teams. You have several years of experience managing and scaling multiple teams.
Data Experience at scale: You’ve been a leader in multiple companies where analytics on top of massive data sets drives product/business decisions and results in powerful data products. You have extensive experience with technologies like SQL, Spark, and Python.
Analytics expertise: You’ll need to be amazing at coming up with new, meaningful metrics to measure the success of our products; you'll be equally strong at making sure the data needed to support those metrics are available. You have multiple years of experience managing decisions at scale, including causal inference and experimentation.
Well-balanced skills: People have trouble pinning you down. Business, product, and technical teams claim you as their own. You are equal parts technical and functional (and both are exceptionally strong), and you are equally comfortable and effective at presenting to technical or business leaders.
Passionate about business strategy: You’ve experienced and thrived in similar channel-related environments and have a knack for working with business users that are responsible for top-line growth.
Key technology stack and tools we work with:
Python
SQL
Spark
Google Cloud Platform
Mode/Tableau
Additional Information
We know that applying to a new role takes a lot of work and we truly value your time. We are looking forward to reading your application. Shopify is now permanently remote and working towards a future that is digital by default. Learn more about what this can mean for you.
At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous people, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Job Description
What you get to do in this role:
Manage a team of 4-6 Data Scientists as they create Machine Learning models that drive our growth across all products. Interact with stakeholders in departments across the company, identify opportunities for Data Science to enhance our business, match the optimal machine learning techniques to the specific business need, and then build the models that get the job done. This is an opportunity for the right candidate to go from end-to-end in the process, from recognizing a problem to implementing the solution, and integrating it with the business teams. You and your team will:
Solicit requirements for Data Science models, including what data they will use and how the company will use them after they are built
Define the variables and their structure, and extract the data from our data warehouse and/or guide specialists to do so
Build predictive models that are accurate, robust, and informative in ways that help our business grow even faster
Teach our business teams what the models do, what the results mean, and how they improve decision-making
Qualifications
In order to be successful in this role, we need someone who has:
An advanced degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, or Artificial Intelligence
Successful project experience in Data Science in an Enterprise setting, and extensive use of methods like: regression, decision trees , random forests, GBMs, Bayesian methods, neural networks/deep learning, support vector machines, recommendation engines, k-nearest neighbor, NLP, Business Process Mining or HMM
Four or more years of experience in building predictive models, defining variables, variable selection, and measuring model quality
Ability to manage several projects simultaneously, scopes projects, realistically estimates work and drive stakeholder/end-user alignment
Experience in model explainability, delivering model explanation/reason codes along with predictions/recommendations
Two or more years managing a team of Data Scientists
Expertise with scripting in R, SAS, Python, or similar tools
Desired Skills:
Experience in manipulating large datasets and using databases, performing SQL queries
Experience with Azure ML, Azure Data Lake, and/or Databricks
Special consideration for applicants experienced in:
Driver/impact analysis
Model validation
Software product usage data

At Talkdesk, we are disruptive risk-takers, don't have a traditional way of doing things, and will do whatever it takes to build a product that improves customer experiences. We help people solve problems in moments that matter.

Join the adventure and grow with us. With $268 million in funding and more than 1,800 customers, we're revolutionizing the industry of contact centers. Join a hyper-growth company that's innovative, bold, and ambitious. Be a part of the future of technology and make an impact on an evolving industry. If you're a self-starter and hungry to learn, apply now and enjoy the ride.

We're looking for the rare breed of data scientist who loves to use their expertise to solve business problems. Your models won't languish in the lab. They will go to production, where they will impact the daily lives of millions of people.


What are we doing?

At Talkdesk we are reimagining how people experience contact centers, helping our customers create long lasting and meaningful relations with their customers. The capacity to make sense of the message that is being conveyed when we communicate has been reserved to humans alone, but we are building the next generation of solutions that will mimic our ability to understand language, ensuring that the customer needs are always well understood and efficiently handled. We are a growing team of curious and talented people that are focused on leveraging the power of Natural Language Processing, audio signal processing, and machine transcription, to deliver added value to our customers.


What do we need?

We are looking for a talented Data Scientist. We need someone that is a natural problem solver, who likes to be challenged, has the drive to explore and is committed to quality. We expect you to be a truly team player, reliable and easy to communicate with. You will have to leverage different techniques to deliver state of the art solutions around natural language understanding and generation. More specifically, you will have to:

Focus on delivering working products/models to production. We don't do pure science at Talkdesk. We do products. We're looking for data scientists who geek out on solving business problems and impacting millions of people's daily lives.
Explore, clean and transform large datasets of unstructured data;
Analyze complex problems and recommend adequate solutions according to the identified requirements;
Apply, combine and fine tune different Natural Language Processing techniques to achieve the best results;
Design, implement and maintain scalable and performant architectures to support the idealized solutions.


What are we looking for?

Experience developing, delivering and operating machine learning-based software in production in the cloud.
Familiarity with NLP tasks (e.g. Information Retrieval, Recommender Systems, Topic Modeling, Summarization, etc);
Familiarity with Machine Learning algorithms (Neural Networks, SVM, Markov Models, Decision Trees, etc);
Familiarity with Big Data frameworks (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc).
Familiarity with MLFlow is a plus.


The Talkdesk story hinges on empathy and acceptance. It is the shared goal among all Talkdeskers to empower a new kind of customer hero through our innovative software solution, and we firmly believe that the best path to success for our mission is inclusivity, diversity, and genuine acceptance. To that end, we will hire, promote, work along, cheer for, bond with, and warmly welcome into the Talkdesk family all persons without regard to ethnic and racial identity, indigenous heritage, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

The Challenge:
Are you excited at the prospect of unlocking the secrets held by a data set? Are you fascinated by the possibilities presented by the IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence advances? In an increasingly connected world, massive amounts of structured and unstructured data open up new opportunities. As a data scientist, you can turn these complex data sets into useful information to solve global challenges. Across private and public sectors — from fraud detection, to cancer research, to national intelligence — you know the answers are in the data.
We have an opportunity for you to use your leadership and analytical skills to solve military intelligence challenges. You’ll work closely with your customer to understand their questions and needs, and then dig into their data-rich environment to find the pieces of their information puzzle. You'll support the development and application of data mining, analysis, aggregation, fusion, and visualization to process, analyze, and integrate data and information that facilitates research, analysis, production and dissemination of Scientific and Technical Intelligence (S&TI) and General Military Intelligence (GMI) assessments. You’ll provide your customer with a deep understanding of their data, what it all means, and how they can use it. Join us as we provide the right information at the right time to support the critical needs of our nation's leaders.
Empower change with us.
You Have:
Experience in the application of mathematical, statistical, or data science analytics
Experience in processing, tagging, and indexing unstructured, semi-structured, and structured classified and unclassified data sets
Experience developing research designs, including formulating testable questions, identifying and defining key concepts and variables, and matching appropriate methods to problems
Experience in data project management, including cleaning and preparing data and creating, structuring, and maintaining data sets
Experience in creating mathematical models and coding in R, Python, and Matlab
Experience in using text and web analytics for establishing and expanding keyword searches and using bibliometric analysis tools to perform horizon scans and deep dives into identified S&T research fields
Knowledge of data analysis, including manipulating datasets and interpreting findings using a mix of programs and environments and techniques
TS/SCI clearance
BA or BS degree and 8+ years of experience in the application of mathematical, statistical or data science analytics or MA or MS degree and 6+ years of experience in the application of mathematical, statistical or data science analytics
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.
Build Your Career:
 At Booz Allen, we know the power of analytics and we’re dedicated to helping you grow as a data analysis professional. When you join Booz Allen, you’ll have the chance to:
access online and onsite training in data analysis and presentation methodologies, and tools like Hortonworks, Docker, Tableau, and Splunk
change the world with the Data Science Bowl—the world’s premier data science for social good competition
participate in partnerships with data science leaders, like our partnership with NVIDIA to deliver Deep Learning Institute (DLI) training to the federal government
You’ll have access to a wealth of training resources through our Analytics University, an online learning portal specifically geared towards data science and analytics skills, where you can access more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and state-of-the-art tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications that directly impact your role? You may be able to take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site bootcamps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. We’ll help you develop the career you want as you chart your own course for success.
We’re an EOE that empowers our people—no matter their race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other protected characteristic—to fearlessly drive change.

Position Summary:
NAR is looking for an experienced and highly skilled Director of Data Science to join NAR's IT team. The Director of Data Science will work as a hands-on leader and manage a very capable data science team on a broad range of topics and projects focused on providing actionable insights to key stakeholders and learning more about our members. Reporting to the Vice President of Information Technology, the Director of Data Science will be a strategic leader who can take the data science capability to the next level. This individual should have ample experience in driving data science related projects with in-house as well as consulting project teams.

The ideal candidates will be able to work effectively in a fast-paced setting, bring a fresh perspective to the data science domain, be passionate about data and all that can be derived from it, and be a collaborative team player.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Shape vision for data science/predictive analytics applications for all areas of the organization
Ability to drive data science programs and projects and see them to their successful completion
Experience with building analytical models to solve complex problems
Hands on experience with data visualization utilizing industry standard tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Have experience with applications on Azure or AWS and their AI/ML tools
Experience with the full machine learning life cycle including predictive data analytics, including data preprocessing model building, and evaluation
Research and implement enterprise best practices in predictive data analytics
Identify and implement appropriate technologies and techniques, from a non-analytical such as data store and analytical perspective such as models like Neural Networks
Identify, evaluate, build, and implement infrastructure and methodologies for enhanced data collection, storage, cataloging, descriptive analysis and predictive modeling and presentation
Design technological solutions that ensure data completeness and accuracy across data mining initiatives
Design technological solutions that ensure reporting consistency across analytical initiatives

Connect and collaborate with data science leaders and experts within and outside of the industry and keep pulse on data science innovations and ensure that REALTORS® are at the forefront of data-driven innovation

Detail, problem solving, and great organizational skills.

Highly collaborative and team oriented

Join the Spark Team
We were born of innovation, springing from the curiosity, imagination and dedication of remarkable scientists and healthcare visionaries. Our shared mission is to challenge the inevitability of genetic disease by discovering, developing, and delivering treatments in ways unimaginable – until now.
We don’t follow footsteps. We create the path.
Primary Duties:
The Software and Data Engineering team within the Data Science Group at Spark Therapeutics is seeking a Senior Data Science Business Analyst for research and lab data management and automation. This role serves as a key group member to support data strategy, process management, business architecture, and solution implementation needs of the department. Primary responsibilities of the SDSBA include:
Work closely with the Lab Automation team, bioinformatics, and machine learning scientists to architect, document, and map out data ingestion, acquisition, and storage solutions.
Develop data dictionary, business flow diagrams, future state process map, and other solutions to facilitate data accessibility and transparency.
Provide data management support for integrated systems such as NGS equipment, and liquid handling instruments.
Consult on the feasibility of data solutions with internal business and IT resources.
Contribute to the documentation of data flow, business requirements, and data infrastructure.
Manage data definition and business rule changes through a defined intake process.

About GrowthBook
Here at GrowthBook we are building an open source A/B testing platform and transforming the way product decisions are made. The top 1% of companies spend thousands of hours making their own highly custom A/B testing platforms. We’ve created GrowthBook to give all companies the power and flexibility of a custom in-house experimentation system without having to build it themselves.
The world of product development is increasingly moving towards data-driven decision making, and the best way to objectively measure the impact of a product is with A/B testing. Top companies already know this, and test everything they ship. As these methods spread, A/B testing will increasingly be part of all product development processes, and will require a new set of tools which are highly integrated and customized to the product and data. GrowthBook is that platform.
Since we launched in May 2021, we’ve added over 1,500 stars on GitHub, and we are the most popular active open source experimentation platform. We’re used by hundreds of companies, and are working closely with fast-growing and large early adopters to help shape our product. Our business has increased 7x in August alone.
Our platform is built using modern tech by very experienced engineers, and backed by top investors. We believe in open source and product-led growth, and we’re focused on building something awesome that our users love.
GrowthBook is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to creating an inclusive, supportive environment for all employees.
We regret that we cannot sponsor employment visas at this time.

Benefits

Work-from-home stipend and IT budget
Remote-first company with regular off sites in exciting locations (once Covid allows us to safely travel again)

Become a Part of the NIKE, Inc. Team
NIKE, Inc. does more than outfit the world's best athletes. It is a place to explore potential, obliterate boundaries and push out the edges of what can be. The company looks for people who can grow, think, dream and create. Its culture thrives by embracing diversity and rewarding imagination. The brand seeks achievers, leaders and visionaries. At Nike, it’s about each person bringing skills and passion to a challenging and constantly evolving game!
Analytics is a competitive differentiator for Nike and is fundamentally changing how the company serves athletes and consumers around the world. The Nike Commercial Analytics team builds analytic-based solutions to manage marketplace and optimize the supply chain. Using big data, advanced analytics and state-of-the-art technology, the team strives to ensure that Nike gets the right product to the right place at the right time for the consumers!
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist to join our Advanced Analytics team within Commercial Analytics serving Global Sourcing & Manufacturing (GSM). This role will be part of a multi-functional agile squad and will provide technical leadership in building predictive and prescriptive analytic solutions to support Nike’s Sourcing and Manufcturing strategies. The team develops analytical solutions across the funactional areas of GSM which include: Sourcing, Costing, Delivery, Product Integrity, Air MI, Sustainability, Materials, Manufacturing and Engineering.
The candidate needs to be a dependable teammate with strong hands-on analytics experience, drive, and curiosity. You know how to rise above the numbers and explain the essential insights to users at all levels. You simplify and distill business complexity into testable hypotheses and scalable solutions. While you are well versed in a plethora of advanced modelling techniques, you are able to identify the technique optimal for the task at hand based on the business requirements, your knowledge of the data and the technique’s assumptions, interpretability and robustness. You ask good questions, are continually learning as well as finding opportunities to share knowledge with others.
WHAT YOU WILL WORK ON
If this is you, you will be part of our GSM Advanced Analytics squad that delivers data science products and solutions to support Nike’s GSM strategies and initiaves across Sourcing, Costing, Delivery, Product Integrity, Air MI, Sustainability, Materials, Manufacturing and Engineering.
You will have opportunities to influence product direction, guide standard methodologies in data science and engineering, and help deliver technical projects from inception to completion. Specifically, you will:
Work with the squad through assessment of business requirements, data constraints, and pros/cons of alternative analytics techniques to determine the best solution approach. Contribute to the planning, scheduling and value measurement of the work to meet timeline targets and success criteria.
Drive implementation, and maintenance of production grade data science (statistical, mathematical and ML/AI based) and operation research models to determine optimal level of factory utilization, capacity, costs, lead times, and reduction of un-planned.
Help deliver improvement of aligning manufacturing capacity with demand by understanding product attributes, partner’s manufacturing capabilities and complexity.
Explore business drivers of cost, on-time performance (of products and materials), root causes of quality issues, and strive to achieve Nike’s sustainability goals.
Help shape Nike’s analytical platforms and products by identifying foundational data science capabilities and creating reusable analytical components.
Support the adoption of analytic products through effective storytelling and collaboration with key partners.
Share knowledge with others on the team; continue to adapt or develop new methods and learn new software packages as available in the literature and recent publications.
WHO YOU WILL WORK WITH
You will work with the Director of Advanced Analytics and serve as a Sr. Data Scientisti in the GSM Advanced analytics squad, which includes other data scientists (and data engineers partners). You will collaborate across the broader organization with business teams in Global Sourcing & Manufacturing, Demand and Supply Management as well as other data, analytics and technology functions at Nike.
WHAT YOU BRING
Advanced quantitative degree (Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Computer Science or related field) and at least 5 years of related industry experience or Bachelor’s degree and 7-12 years related industry experience.
Working knowledge of modern data science techniques and methodogies, including statistical and mathematical modeling along with machine learning algorithms.
Intermediate to advanced skills in programming languages (particularly Python and SQL) and ability to apply them for data acquisition, preprocessing, modeling and monitoring.
Familiarity with the wide range of data science/analytics software tools (e.g. Jupyter Notebook, SQL consoles, Hadoop, Spark) and cloud computing platforms (e.g. Amazon Web Services).
Experience in building, training, scoring, tuning and maintaining predictive models in production at enterprise scale and familiarity with mainstream packages relevant to managing all stages of Data Science/Analytics lifecycle.
Familiarity with the Agile development process and demonstrable ability to prepare a project plan, communicate the plan to the team and break the work down to trackable tasks.
Proven track record of working cross functionally and critically evaluate complex business information from multiple perspectives, including questioning assumptions and validity.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including ability to develop and deliver presentation.

Our growing Data Science team is central to our global strategy. Their work enables our clients to quickly create and deploy solutions that drive innovation, optimize operations, uncover insights and accelerate business transformation. Ultimately the team is responsible for enabling our clients to outpace their competitors, by generating ROI from data science initiatives with products that transform data into actionable insights.

Operating across sectors and with a high degree of independence, our data scientists have helped improve performance for F1 racing teams, built solutions for anomaly detection and pattern classification to optimize yield in manufacturing operations, and initiated changes in California traffic laws.


We are looking for a Lead Data Scientist/ML Engineer to join our team. You will join a team of highly collaborative individuals as a senior team member and play a key role in developing our capability and establishing TIBCO leadership in the analytics and data science space. You will advance our AI/ML product and technology capabilities, lead client conversations and draw together our TIBCO user community. The role can be based in Boston, Chapel Hill, Washington DC, Houston or New York City.

What You'll Do
Deliver Innovation: Define and direct development of novel AI/ML data science software features. Contribute to the TIBCO Data Science platform.
Work with Customers: Engage through pre-sales and post-sales support—including proof of concepts and data science consulting—typically developing AI/ML models that are deployed into operational systems.
Increase Awareness: Create technical marketing content, product documents and demonstrations, white papers and/or blogs for the TIBCO user community. Represent the data science team as a speaker or instructor in industry events and external conferences.
Collaborate across stakeholder teams on specific industry knowledge, analytics use cases and customer stories.
Who You Are
5+ years of experience in advanced data analysis and delivery of demonstrations, projects, engagements or deployed software applications. Experience with applying predictive analytics such as machine learning and optimization techniques to large, complex and disparate data sources.
5+ years of experience with Python or Scala/Spark, some knowledge of SQL and experience with other software environments e.g. SAS, Matlab, Spotfire, Tableau, Qlikview, SPSS, KNIME and/or other data science tools; Cloud and Cloud-ML experience such as Azure, AWS and GCP is a plus. Experience with software components for data preparation and integration e.g. Data Virtualization and Big Data tools such as Hadoop and Spark and/or further programming or scripting environments e.g. .Net, Java, IronPython, Javascript, C++ is a plus.
The ability to comfortably communicate with industry personnel, provide compelling presentations and demonstrations of analytics software, and represent the value of analytics projects in some industry sectors such as Financial Services, Manufacturing, Energy, Telecommunications or Retail.
A Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science or related analytical field of study with graduate classes in statistics and data mining. A Masters degree is aplus.
Capable of working in a dynamic, fast paced environment.
Language skills: Business level English

In this role, you will lead analytics projects pertaining to all sources of agent and customer level data, outlier management, better customer experience and operation efficiency, and increased revenue. Lead the design and development of machine learning/statistical models in agent anomaly detection, forensic analytics and proactive modeling.
Work closely with engineers to deploy models in production both in real time and in batch and systematically track model performance, including creating and monitoring the dashboards.

Build strong working relationships and develop deep partnerships with vendor management, compliance and Marketing lines of businesses.
Prepare and present executive summaries of findings and detailed working team communications, with responsive iterations on such presentations based on individual data visualization preferences.
Drive technical innovation through active research and application of new theories, techniques, and technologies.

None

Advanced degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Physics, or a related quantitative field is required for this position
2+ year experience with call center/chat agent analysis and reporting in sales, marketing and financial services preferred.
3+ years building machine learning and statistical models for supervised and unsupervised learning, understanding of underlying algorithms, ability to tune and analyze algorithms and extract actionable insights. These methods include (but are not limited to) regression analysis, clustering, outlier detection, decision trees, collaborative filtering, nearest neighbors and ensemble methods

About GrowthBook
Here at GrowthBook we are building an open source A/B testing platform and transforming the way product decisions are made. The top 1% of companies spend thousands of hours making their own highly custom A/B testing platforms. We’ve created GrowthBook to give all companies the power and flexibility of a custom in-house experimentation system without having to build it themselves.
The world of product development is increasingly moving towards data-driven decision making, and the best way to objectively measure the impact of a product is with A/B testing. Top companies already know this, and test everything they ship. As these methods spread, A/B testing will increasingly be part of all product development processes, and will require a new set of tools which are highly integrated and customized to the product and data. GrowthBook is that platform.
Since we launched in May 2021, we’ve added over 1,500 stars on GitHub, and we are the most popular active open source experimentation platform. We’re used by hundreds of companies, and are working closely with fast-growing and large early adopters to help shape our product. Our business has increased 7x in August alone.
Our platform is built using modern tech by very experienced engineers, and backed by top investors. We believe in open source and product-led growth, and we’re focused on building something awesome that our users love.
GrowthBook is an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to creating an inclusive, supportive environment for all employees.
We regret that we cannot sponsor employment visas at this time.

Job Description:
Pre-Sales DataScience, Channel Partnership
DataRobot is the world’s premier AI and data science platform. Our Channel Data Science team consists of applied data scientists, passionate about using machine learning to achieve real-world results and scale the impact of DataRobot. As part of the Channel Data Science team at DataRobot, you will collaborate closely with DataRobot partners and bring expertise in data science and the DataRobot platform to build DataRobot partner ecosystem and help end customers achieve their organization’s objectives with AI. You’ll work with partners and end customers in a range of industries on diverse use cases, and with both business (executive, line of business) and technical (data science, engineering, analytics) stakeholders.
Responsibilities
Help to scale the growth of DataRobot through working with different types of partner organizations.
Build DataRobot partner ecosystem and forge strategic partnership with key partners together with our partner managers.
In the engagement process with partners and end customers, represent the DataRobot product to various personas across the partner and customer organisations spanning from data scientists to C-level executives.
Lead product demonstrations, align DataRobot to the vision of the customers’ goals, lead the Proof Of Value process, and quantify the business impact of DataRobot.
Influence our partners and customers through thought leadership by translating complex technical terms / processes into business outcomes / value-based messaging.
Act as a trusted advisor on AI across the customer lifecycle; build champions by enabling partner and customer teams to solve complex data science problems using DataRobot – including problem framing, data preparation, scripting, model building, model deployment, model management, and output consumption.
Work in tight collaboration with the DataRobot sales team as well as the partner teams to ultimately support the end customers achieving their goals with DataRobot.
Act internally as the voice of the customer to the Product, Engineering, and Marketing.
Present at conferences and/or help create other marketing content.
Requirements
3+ years of experience in Data Science/predictive modeling. Strong candidates with 2+ years as a Data Scientist will also be considered.
2+ years of experience in customer facing role
Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a quantitative subject
Hands-on experience building and implementing machine learning or AI models
Experience collaborating with business stakeholders to ensure that machine learning solutions deliver successfully on business outcomes
Strong customer interaction, communication, writing and interpersonal skills
Excellent project management and organizational abilities
Familiarity with a variety of technical tools for the manipulation of data
Ability to understand, write and collaborate with Python or R
Regional travel may be required
Desired :
Advanced degree
Familiarity with consultative sales process in the data / analytics marketplace
Familiarity with data platform technology integrations
Experience dealing with channel partners
Fluency with scripting in Python or R
DataRobot is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Position Summary:
NAR is looking for an experienced and highly skilled Director of Data Science to join NAR's IT team. The Director of Data Science will work as a hands-on leader and manage a very capable data science team on a broad range of topics and projects focused on providing actionable insights to key stakeholders and learning more about our members. Reporting to the Vice President of Information Technology, the Director of Data Science will be a strategic leader who can take the data science capability to the next level. This individual should have ample experience in driving data science related projects with in-house as well as consulting project teams.

The ideal candidates will be able to work effectively in a fast-paced setting, bring a fresh perspective to the data science domain, be passionate about data and all that can be derived from it, and be a collaborative team player.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Shape vision for data science/predictive analytics applications for all areas of the organization
Ability to drive data science programs and projects and see them to their successful completion
Experience with building analytical models to solve complex problems
Hands on experience with data visualization utilizing industry standard tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Have experience with applications on Azure or AWS and their AI/ML tools
Experience with the full machine learning life cycle including predictive data analytics, including data preprocessing model building, and evaluation
Research and implement enterprise best practices in predictive data analytics
Identify and implement appropriate technologies and techniques, from a non-analytical such as data store and analytical perspective such as models like Neural Networks
Identify, evaluate, build, and implement infrastructure and methodologies for enhanced data collection, storage, cataloging, descriptive analysis and predictive modeling and presentation
Design technological solutions that ensure data completeness and accuracy across data mining initiatives
Design technological solutions that ensure reporting consistency across analytical initiatives
Deliver data products and dashboards that help enhance understanding of organization trends, and support member's businesses
Connect and collaborate with data science leaders and experts within and outside of the industry and keep pulse on data science innovations and ensure that REALTORS® are at the forefront of data-driven innovation
Educate, mentor, and train the data science team, other IT teams, staff, and members on data science
Other duties, as assigned

Qualifications:

Minimum of 8-10 years of overall data science experience
Working knowledge and experience in Cloud, endpoint, server, database, application, and cyber security
Detail, problem solving, and great organizational skills.
Excellent communication skills with ability to provide appropriate level of detail (verbal and written) to both technical and non-technical individuals.
Results oriented with high attention to detail, ability to multi-task, and meet deadlines in a dynamic, fast-paced team environment
Highly collaborative and team oriented
Ability to travel up to 10%

Organizational Overview:
The National Association of REALTORS® (NAR) is a team of professionals dedicated to providing world-class service to over 1.5 million REALTORS® working in the United States and around the world. The real estate industry is fast-paced and fast-changing--each year, our members participate in the sale, lease, and management of billions of dollars in real estate. As in every industry, our members' value proposition is constantly being challenged by innovation.

It is our mission to help REALTORS® navigate that change and thrive in their careers. We cannot do that without the ideas, passion, and commitment from our talented employees. As our greatest assets, employees are offered their pick of competitive benefits/perks and flexible work options. NAR is certified as a Great Place to Work®. Our most successful employees are committed to our Core Values, which are:

Putting members first
Leading change
Advancing Diversity and Inclusion
Giving respect
Collaborating
Communicating

Join the Spark Team
We were born of innovation, springing from the curiosity, imagination and dedication of remarkable scientists and healthcare visionaries. Our shared mission is to challenge the inevitability of genetic disease by discovering, developing, and delivering treatments in ways unimaginable – until now.
We don’t follow footsteps. We create the path.
Primary Duties:
The Software and Data Engineering team within the Data Science Group at Spark Therapeutics is seeking a Senior Data Science Business Analyst for research and lab data management and automation. This role serves as a key group member to support data strategy, process management, business architecture, and solution implementation needs of the department. Primary responsibilities of the SDSBA include:
Work closely with the Lab Automation team, bioinformatics, and machine learning scientists to architect, document, and map out data ingestion, acquisition, and storage solutions.
Develop data dictionary, business flow diagrams, future state process map, and other solutions to facilitate data accessibility and transparency.
Provide data management support for integrated systems such as NGS equipment, and liquid handling instruments.
Consult on the feasibility of data solutions with internal business and IT resources.
Contribute to the documentation of data flow, business requirements, and data infrastructure.
Manage data definition and business rule changes through a defined intake process.
Ensures quality and integrity of master data in key systems, as well as development and documentation of processes with other functional data owners to support ongoing maintenance.
Liaise with internal and external stakeholders translating requirements into highly specified project briefs.
Perform analysis and design activities on Business and IT initiatives by eliciting, defining, validating, and translating business functional, non-functional and information objectives, then validating them when implemented.
Ensure appropriate project documentation is compiled and proper review and approvals from respective teams and stakeholders are gathered and collated.
Help increase project transparency and progress tracking through detailed and intuitive documentation.

40
Track and document current processes, design future state roadmaps, and business flow diagrams.
30
Collaborate with different stakeholders to gather requirements, provide insight, and make recommendations as to the subject matter expert.

Create dashboards, reports, and visualization solutions.

B.S. in Computer science, or related field.
+5 years of experience working as a business analyst, focused on functional requirements gathering and data flow mapping.
+2 years of experience with Tableau, Looker, or other BI, reporting, and visualization tools.
+2 years of experience with data governance tool suites (e.g., Informatica, Collibra, Alation, etc.), and implementation/operational usage Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Quality capabilities within these tools.
Deep understanding of data management, integration, modeling, and profiling concepts.
Good understanding of Data Lake/Hadoop platform implementation.
Experience in biotech/pharma is highly preferred.

Experience in capturing complex business requirements, analyzing and translating them into easily understandable functional requirements.
Proven experience working on big data operations, documenting and mapping structured/unstructured data pipelines, and ETL/ELT solutions.
Strong client-engagement skills and ability to explain complex technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
Knowledge of data modeling (relational and non-relational) concepts and principles.
Proven ability to work independently, self-motivated to learn and develop new methodologies, manage multiple projects simultaneously, keep accurate records, follow instructions, and comply with company policies.
Knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies, Software Development Life Cycle, Source Control systems, Git conventions, and CI/CD pipelines.

Job Location: This position can be located in the Chicago, IL or Washington, DC office

Position Summary:
NAR is looking for an experienced and highly skilled Director of Data Science to join NAR's IT team. The Director of Data Science will work as a hands-on leader and manage a very capable data science team on a broad range of topics and projects focused on providing actionable insights to key stakeholders and learning more about our members. Reporting to the Vice President of Information Technology, the Director of Data Science will be a strategic leader who can take the data science capability to the next level. This individual should have ample experience in driving data science related projects with in-house as well as consulting project teams.

The ideal candidates will be able to work effectively in a fast-paced setting, bring a fresh perspective to the data science domain, be passionate about data and all that can be derived from it, and be a collaborative team player.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Shape vision for data science/predictive analytics applications for all areas of the organization
Ability to drive data science programs and projects and see them to their successful completion
Experience with building analytical models to solve complex problems
Hands on experience with data visualization utilizing industry standard tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Have experience with applications on Azure or AWS and their AI/ML tools
Experience with the full machine learning life cycle including predictive data analytics, including data preprocessing model building, and evaluation
Research and implement enterprise best practices in predictive data analytics
Identify and implement appropriate technologies and techniques, from a non-analytical such as data store and analytical perspective such as models like Neural Networks
Identify, evaluate, build, and implement infrastructure and methodologies for enhanced data collection, storage, cataloging, descriptive analysis and predictive modeling and presentation
Design technological solutions that ensure data completeness and accuracy across data mining initiatives
Design technological solutions that ensure reporting consistency across analytical initiatives
Deliver data products and dashboards that help enhance understanding of organization trends, and support member's businesses
Connect and collaborate with data science leaders and experts within and outside of the industry and keep pulse on data science innovations and ensure that REALTORS® are at the forefront of data-driven innovation
Educate, mentor, and train the data science team, other IT teams, staff, and members on data science
Other duties, as assigned

Qualifications:

Minimum of 8-10 years of overall data science experience
Working knowledge and experience in Cloud, endpoint, server, database, application, and cyber security
Detail, problem solving, and great organizational skills.
Excellent communication skills with ability to provide appropriate level of detail (verbal and written) to both technical and non-technical individuals.
Results oriented with high attention to detail, ability to multi-task, and meet deadlines in a dynamic, fast-paced team environment
Highly collaborative and team oriented
Ability to travel up to 10%

Organizational Overview:
The National Association of REALTORS® (NAR) is a team of professionals dedicated to providing world-class service to over 1.5 million REALTORS® working in the United States and around the world. The real estate industry is fast-paced and fast-changing--each year, our members participate in the sale, lease, and management of billions of dollars in real estate. As in every industry, our members' value proposition is constantly being challenged by innovation.

It is our mission to help REALTORS® navigate that change and thrive in their careers. We cannot do that without the ideas, passion, and commitment from our talented employees. As our greatest assets, employees are offered their pick of competitive benefits/perks and flexible work options. NAR is certified as a Great Place to Work®. Our most successful employees are committed to our Core Values, which are:

Putting members first
Leading change
Advancing Diversity and Inclusion
Giving respect
Collaborating
Communicating

Join the Spark Team
We were born of innovation, springing from the curiosity, imagination and dedication of remarkable scientists and healthcare visionaries. Our shared mission is to challenge the inevitability of genetic disease by discovering, developing, and delivering treatments in ways unimaginable – until now.
We don’t follow footsteps. We create the path.
Primary Duties:
The Software and Data Engineering team within the Data Science Group at Spark Therapeutics is seeking a Senior Data Science Business Analyst for research and lab data management and automation. This role serves as a key group member to support data strategy, process management, business architecture, and solution implementation needs of the department. Primary responsibilities of the SDSBA include:
Work closely with the Lab Automation team, bioinformatics, and machine learning scientists to architect, document, and map out data ingestion, acquisition, and storage solutions.
Develop data dictionary, business flow diagrams, future state process map, and other solutions to facilitate data accessibility and transparency.
Provide data management support for integrated systems such as NGS equipment, and liquid handling instruments.
Consult on the feasibility of data solutions with internal business and IT resources.
Contribute to the documentation of data flow, business requirements, and data infrastructure.
Manage data definition and business rule changes through a defined intake process.
Ensures quality and integrity of master data in key systems, as well as development and documentation of processes with other functional data owners to support ongoing maintenance.
Liaise with internal and external stakeholders translating requirements into highly specified project briefs.
Perform analysis and design activities on Business and IT initiatives by eliciting, defining, validating, and translating business functional, non-functional and information objectives, then validating them when implemented.
Ensure appropriate project documentation is compiled and proper review and approvals from respective teams and stakeholders are gathered and collated.
Help increase project transparency and progress tracking through detailed and intuitive documentation.
Responsibilities:
% of Time
40
Track and document current processes, design future state roadmaps, and business flow diagrams.
30
Collaborate with different stakeholders to gather requirements, provide insight, and make recommendations as to the subject matter expert.
30
Create dashboards, reports, and visualization solutions.
Education and Experience Requirements:
B.S. in Computer science, or related field.
+5 years of experience working as a business analyst, focused on functional requirements gathering and data flow mapping.
+2 years of experience with Tableau, Looker, or other BI, reporting, and visualization tools.
+2 years of experience with data governance tool suites (e.g., Informatica, Collibra, Alation, etc.), and implementation/operational usage Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Quality capabilities within these tools.
Deep understanding of data management, integration, modeling, and profiling concepts.
Good understanding of Data Lake/Hadoop platform implementation.
Experience in biotech/pharma is highly preferred.
Key Skills, Abilities, and Competencies:
Experience in capturing complex business requirements, analyzing and translating them into easily understandable functional requirements.
Proven experience working on big data operations, documenting and mapping structured/unstructured data pipelines, and ETL/ELT solutions.
Strong client-engagement skills and ability to explain complex technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
Knowledge of data modeling (relational and non-relational) concepts and principles.
Proven ability to work independently, self-motivated to learn and develop new methodologies, manage multiple projects simultaneously, keep accurate records, follow instructions, and comply with company policies.
Knowledge of Agile/Scrum methodologies, Software Development Life Cycle, Source Control systems, Git conventions, and CI/CD pipelines.
Knowledge of enterprise software patterns and conventions.
Ability to ramp up quickly and learn tools and technologies
Excellent communication skills (both oral and written)
Ability to write clear documentation, present technical solutions/outlooks, and simplify complex processes.
Works with colleagues as a team player.
Complexity and Problem Solving:
Develops solutions to a variety of complex problems
Refers to established procedures and policies
Work is performed under general direction
Participates in determining objectives of the assignment
Plan schedules and arranges own activities in accomplishing objectives
Work is reviewed upon completion for adequacy in meeting objectives
Complete understanding and application of principles, concepts, practices, standards
Knowledge of industry practices
Failure to achieve objectives would normally have a serious effect upon the administration of the organization
